thread.title: Aurigny plane back in action after being struck by lightning
thread.title_full: Aurigny plane back in action after being struck by lightning | Channel - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Aurigny plane back in action after being struck by lightning
text:
An Aurigny plane, which was struck by lightning yesterday will be back in service this evening.
The Aurigny’s Embraer 195 has undergone a rigorous technical inspection say the company.
A small section to the rear of the upper tail was damaged when lightning hit the aircraft. Engineers have carried out work on this area and have approved its return to service.
Aurigny say the certification to fly is only achieved after a detailed evaluation to ensure it is entirely safe.
Further work, to carry out a permanent repair, will be undertaken next week.
The flight will leave London Gatwick at 7pm.
Aurigny say because of the extremely wet weather, coupled with the length of Guernsey’s runway, they have taken the decision, where necessary, to leave bags behind.
They say they hope to get all our passengers’ luggage back to Guernsey by tomorrow, with a fair proportion arriving tonight. Passengers will be contacted by Aurigny as their bags arrive and we ask that they wait until they are contacted by us.
Last updated Fri 14 Aug 2015 Travel Guernsey Jersey
